title: Michigan Senate candidate Mike Rogers slams Slotkin for staying silent on Tlaib
message:
Michigan’s Republican Senate candidate Mike Rogers is taking Rep. Elissa Slotkin (D-MI) and her fellow Michigan Democrats to task for refusing to condemn an anti-Israel conference — featuring speakers with links to terrorist groups — that Rep. Rashida Tlaib (D-MI) addressed lastweekend.
“Slotkins astounding lack of judgement and the consequences as a result only lead to more antisemitism and violence towards Jews.
“Hatred is hatred.
They are standing up, preaching hatred to Jewish Americans, certainly Israeli citizens, and promoting and encouraging this behavior on college campuses,” he said.
Where is your red line, President Biden?” Tlaib told the crowd.
event_breakdown: Michigan's Republican Senate candidate Mike Rogers calls out a Democratic lawmaker for not condemning a pro-Palestinian event featuring speakers with ties to terrorist groups. Rep. Elissa Slotkin is accused of not speaking out against Rep. Rashida Tlaib's attendance at a conference promoting hatred towards Jews and Israelis. Rogers warns Slotkin's silence could lead to more antisemitism and violence.

title: Australian antisemitism skyrockets in the wake of war in Gaza
message:
Incidents of antisemitism skyrocketed across Australia following October 7, a survey of thousands of Australian Jews has found.
Since the beginning of the war, one in five Jewish adults had personally experienced insults or harassment because of their background, according to the results of the survey, conducted in November.
Australia has seen a vocal protest movement against Israel mushroom since October, with standout incidents including a now-infamous occasion when protestors at the Sydney Opera House were filmed chanting what some believe to be “Gas the Jews”.
More than two-thirds of Jewish students studying at Australian universities said they had personally encountered hostility towards Israel from other students at their university, according to the poll.

By Lior Kaufman and Malky Waksberg
Mount Scopus Memorial College, a Jewish school in Melbourne's east, was targeted by vandals earlier this week. School gates were spray-painted with graffiti reading "Jew Die" outside the school's entrance on Wednesday morning. The blue graffiti was cleaned by staff before students arrived for classes.

"We are working hard with police, government, and Jewish organizations to bring the perpetrators to justice," the school said in a message to parents on Wednesday evening. The school will be "working closely with the Mount Scopus College Enhancement Committee, the college's partner organizations, Victorian police, and the Jewish Community Security Group to detect any potential future threats and act on them effectively," the school said.

Senior Police Constable Kirsten Cooke said on Wednesday afternoon police were investigating the incident and the school management were providing CCTV footage to assist.

Mount Scopus Memorial College principal, Richard Lewis, told The AJN on Wednesday afternoon that the school's head of security had been alerted to the graffiti by parents and had immediately notified the police. "No graffiti" was written on one undamaged panel, Lewis added.

title: Protesters Assault , Interrupt Harvard Interim President at Alumni Day Speech
message:
Protesters interrupted Harvard University interim president Alan Garber Friday during “Alumni Day” proceedings in Harvard Yard, with one person storming the stage and dumping green glitter all over Garber as he delivered a speech.
Video of the proceedings appeared to have been taken offline, though not until Breitbart News saw the footage.
Later, pro-Palestinian protesters interrupted Garber’s remarks, earning boos from some of the alumni present.
Last week’s Harvard commencement ceremony was marred by a speech that included antisemitic rhetoric.
In recent weeks, an “encampment” was set up in Harvard Yard that was only dismantled after the administration capitulated to many of its demands.
event_breakdown:
* Anti-Semitic graffiti found in Harvard Square.
* Protesters disrupted Harvard's "Alumni Day" proceedings, with one person dumping green glitter on interim president Alan Garber as he gave a speech.
* Last week's commencement ceremony at Harvard University was marred by a speech that included anti-Semitic rhetoric.

title: NYPD to step up security for Israel parade – The Forward
message:
By Luke Tress May 31, 2024The NYPD will increase security for Sunday’s Israel parade due to tensions surrounding the war in Gaza and after months of increased antisemitism in the city, but said there are no known threats to the annual event.
Drones along the parade route and its outer perimeter will look for groups coming to disrupt the event.
“These security measures are a little bit more increased from last year but these measures aren’t new,” said NYPD Chief of Department Jeffrey Maddrey.
Despite the concerns, Caban said, “There is no specific or credible threats to the parade or to New York City in general.” He urged participants to report any suspicious activity to police.
The NYPD also urged participants to travel to the event by public transportation because there will be limited parking and heavy traffic.

title: Israelis in NY protest Netanyahu allies participating in parade – The Forward
message:
The signatories — largely Israelis who live in the New York City area — have asked the parade’s organizers to exclude members of Israel’s governing right-wing and religious coalition.
Last year, too, the parade fielded requests from Israeli protesters to exclude government officials: At the time, the protesters opposed the coalition’s efforts to overhaul the judiciary.
But the organization told the New York Jewish Week that, just like last year, Israeli dignitaries will be welcome on Fifth Avenue.
A group representing the families, the Hostages and Missing Families Forum, on Friday accused the government of “sacrificing” the captives.
“Our biggest fear going forward with the American Jewish community is that they’re going to normalize this government,” one of the letter’s organizers, Gili Getz, told the New York Jewish Week.
